intro: Psychotria choriophylla, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
